item.title: Making of Tiger #6, Stack frames
item.description: Intro Link to heading In this post we’re going to add support for stack frames. Here I’ve made some notes while reading the chapter 6 to make sure I understand things clearly. Stack Link to heading A stack is a region of memory that grows downward and shrinks upward (like icicles). The top of the stack is it’s lowest memory address. We treat stack as a big array, with a special register – the stack pointer (SP).
